cash.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques, credit cards etc
cash.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
The traffic police will accept fines in cash immediately.
The shop charges less if the customer pays in cash.
cash.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Health and education need cash from the government.
A phone line to help children in trouble has been closed due to lack of cash.
Charity workers must constantly raise more cash (=collect more money) for the needy.
The company found itself strapped for cash (=without enough money) to pay taxes.
cash.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: money
cash.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: She organized a series of events to raise cash for cancer charities.
Campaigners are urging the government to provide more cash for health care.
The website generates cash from advertising, and by charging for downloads.
They won’t take credit cards, so you have to pay cash.
You should put any spare cash into a savings account.
The company was having a few problems with cash flow.
the cash crisis in some developing countries
The winner will get a cash prize of £10,000.
Conservation projects in the region are being given a cash boost of £40,000.
The organization’s cash resources are limited.
Experts always advise people to build up a cash reserve.
The land is used to grow cash crops like cocoa, tea, and coffee.
Many airlines are strapped for cash at the moment.
cash.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: money in the form of notes and coins, rather than cheques, credit cards etc
cash.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: I’m bringing $400 in traveller’s cheques and $100 in cash.
All deals are done in hard cash or by bank transfer.
cash.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to pay for something immediately with money or a cheque, rather than at a later time
cash.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Are you paying cash or do you have an account?
cash.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: money rather than shares, bonds etc
cash.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Instead of paying cash for their bonds, they can offer bondholders common shares.
The real debt crisis won’t come until next year, when it must start paying cash instead of paper to some debt holders.
cash.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: money that is immediately available, for example in bank accounts or in the form of shares etc that can be easily sold
cash.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: The company has $1 billion in ready cash and the ability to borrow much more.
cash.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: having more money going out of a business than coming in
cash.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: having more money coming into a business than going out
cash.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to exchange a cheque etc for cash
cash.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Can you cash my traveller’s cheques here?
